title: Burnout & Functional Depletion
description: Assess your emotional exhaustion, structural fatigue, and signs of prolonged professional or academic stress.

questions.text: When I think about my daily responsibilities or projects, I mostly feel...

options.text: Motivated, even if tired.
Like my energy is dragging.
A sense of heavy dread.
Entirely numb; I cannot care anymore.

insight_cloud.title: More Than Just Tired
insight_cloud.text: Burnout differs from standard fatigue. Occupational frameworks emphasize that burnout involves 'depersonalization'—a protective numbness that sets in when you endure prolonged, systemic stress without adequate relief.

questions.text: Regarding my cognitive focus over the last month, I notice...

options.text: I can focus well on complex tasks.
My attention wanders more than usual.
I frequently blank out or forget simple things.
Brain fog is so severe I cannot complete basic work.

questions.text: Toward the people I interact with daily (clients, peers, family), my attitude has become...

options.text: Empathetic and engaged.
Quick to irritate over small mistakes.
Cynical, feeling like their problems aren't real.
Hostile or deeply disconnected; I view everyone as a burden.

questions.clinical_context: Aligned with WHODAS 2.0 assessing functional impairment in daily responsibilities.

questions.text: Physiologically, when I finish my day, my body feels...

options.text: Naturally tired, ready for rest.
Achy but manageable.
Wired but physically depleted (tired but can't sleep).
Constantly sick, experiencing migraines, or severe fatigue.

insight_cloud.title: Your Right to Rest
insight_cloud.text: Under the Mental Healthcare Act (2017), your psychological well-being is a protected right. Experiencing profound exhaustion means your system requires structural rest, and prioritizing that recovery is a critical health necessity, not a luxury.

questions.text: Have you significantly neglected your basic needs (food, hydration, hygiene) to cope with the stress?

options.text: No, I maintain my routines.
Only occasionally when swamped.
Yes, I often skip meals or sleep to keep up.
Yes, I have abandoned self-care completely.
